text: was a Japanese football player and manager. He managed for Japan national team. ==Biography== Sasaki was born in Fukushima Prefecture in 1891. After graduating from Tokyo Higher Normal School, in May 1921, he became manager for Japan national team for Far Eastern Championship Games in Shanghai. He managed 2 matches at this competition, but Japan lost in both matches (1-3, v PhilippinesJapan Football Association and 0-4, v Republic of ChinaJapan Football Association). These matches are not counted as "International A Match" because Japan Football Association was not founded yet.Japan Football Association After the retirement, Sasaki became professor and he taught at Utsunomiya University, Fukushima University, Chukyo University and Japan Women's College of Physical Education and so on. On July 23, 1982, Sasaki died of lung thrombus in Suginami, Tokyo at the age of 91. ==References== Category:1891 births Category:1982 deaths Category:Footballers from Fukushima Prefecture Category:Japanese football managers Category:Japan national football team managers
